Diperiksa Sebagai Tersangka Dugaan Suap Minyak, Bambang Irianto Belum Ditahan KPK
05 Nov 2019, 20:45 by Eko Sulestyono


Diperiksa Sebagai Tersangka Dugaan Suap Minyak, Bambang Irianto Belum Ditahan KPK

KBRN, Jakarta : Penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) selesai melakukan pemeriksaan terhadap Bambang Irianto. Bambang sebelumnya diketahui merupakan mantan Managing Director Pertamina Energy Service Pte Ltd (PES).
Meski Bambang hari ini diperiksa  dalam kapasitasnya sebagai tersangka dalam kasus perkara dugaan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) suap perdagangan minyak mentah, namun penyidik KPK rupanya masih belum menahan yang bersangkutan 
Bambang keluar meninggalkan Gedung KPK Jakarta dengan didampingi pengacara sekaligus kuasa hukumnya Soesilo Ariwibowo. Bambang sebelumnya diketahui juga pernah menjabat sebagai Direktur Utama (Dirut) Pertamina Energy Tranding Ltd (Petral) yang akhirnya dibubarkan pada 2015.
Sebelum meninggalkan Gedung KPK Jakarta, Bambang sempat memberikan keterangan singkat kepada wartawan. Bambang memgaku bahwa selama proses pemeriksaan, menurutnya penyidik KPK sangat profesional. 
Bambang sempat ditanya seputar tugasnya sebagai Vice President serta Managing Director Pertamina Energy Service Pte Ltd (PES).
“Tadi sempat ditanya soal adanya penerimaan uang USD 2,9 juta, masih sepitar tupoksi tugas pokok dan fungsi (Tupoksi), didalami tupoksi saya saja sebagai VP dan Managing Director, ya ikuti prosesnya, kita ikut proses saya warga negara yang baik saya percaya dengan lembaga ini KPK, kita ikuti semua proses hukumnya” kata Bambang kepada wartawan di Gedung KPK Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Sebelulmya penyidik KPK menetapkan Bambang sebagai tersangka karena diduga menerima uang suap sebesat 2,9 juta Dolar Amerika (USD) melalui perusahaan miliknya yang didirikannya di British Virgin Island. Perusahaan itu bernama SIAM Group Holding Ltd. 
Penyidik KPK meyakini bahwa pemberian uang suap kepada Bambang itu diduga karena yang bersangkutan ikut membantu mengamankan jatah Kernel Oil terkait tender proyek pengadaan atau penjualan minyak mentah atau produk kilang.
KPK memduga bahwa Bambang bersama sejumlah pejabat PES lainnya diduga ikut menentukan rekanan yang akan diundang mengikuti tender. Salah satu rekanan yang ikut adalah NOC (National Oil Company) yang sering diundang untuk mengikuti tender dan akhirnya menjadi pihak yang mengirimkan kargo untuk PES/PT Pertamina (Persero) adalah Emirates National Oil Company (ENOC). 
Petral itu awalnya didirikan untuk menciptakan ketahanan nasional, khususnya di bidang energi. PT Pertamina (Persero) membentuk Petral dengan fungsi sebagai Integrated Supply Chain (ISC). Fungsi ini seharusnya bertugas untuk melaksanakan kegiatan perencanaan, pengadaan, tukar-menukar, penjualan minyak mentah, intermedia, serta produk kilang untuk komersial dan operasional.

Examined as a Suspect of Oil Bribery Suspect, Bambang Irianto Has Not Been Detained by KPK
05 Nov 2019, 20:45 by Eko Sulestyono


Examined as a Suspect of Oil Bribery Suspect, Bambang Irianto Has Not Been Detained by KPK

KBRN, Jakarta: Investigators of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) have finished investigating Bambang Irianto. Bambang was previously known to be a former Managing Director of Pertamina Energy Service Pte Ltd (PES).
Although Bambang was examined today in his capacity as a suspect in a case of alleged corruption in the bribery of the crude oil trade, the KPK investigators apparently still have not detained the person concerned
Bambang left the Jakarta KPK Building accompanied by his lawyer and legal representative Soesilo Ariwibowo. Bambang was previously known to have also served as Managing Director (Managing Director) of Pertamina Energy Tranding Ltd (Petral) which was finally dissolved in 2015.
Before leaving the Jakarta KPK Building, Bambang briefly gave a brief statement to reporters. Bambang admitted that during the examination process, according to him, KPK investigators were very professional.
Bambang was asked about his duties as Vice President and Managing Director of Pertamina Energy Service Pte Ltd (PES).
"Earlier I was asked about the receipt of USD 2.9 million, still around the main tasks and functions (Tupoksi), I just explored my duty as VP and Managing Director, yes, follow the process, we follow the process I am a good citizen I believe in this institution KPK, we follow all the legal processes "said Bambang told reporters at the KPK Building Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
Earlier, KPK investigators named Bambang a suspect for allegedly accepting bribes of 2.9 million US dollars (USD) through a company he founded in the British Virgin Island. The company was named SIAM Group Holding Ltd.
KPK investigators believe that giving bribes to Bambang was allegedly because he was involved in helping secure Kernel Oil rations related to the tender for the procurement or sale of crude oil or refinery products.
The KPK suspected that Bambang, along with a number of other PES officials, were allegedly involved in deciding which partners would be invited to participate in the tender. One of the partners who participated was the NOC (National Oil Company), which was often invited to take part in tenders and eventually became the party that sent cargo to PES / PT Pertamina (Persero), the Emirates National Oil Company (ENOC).
The Petral was originally founded to create national security, especially in the energy sector. PT Pertamina (Persero) formed Petral with the function as Integrated Supply Chain (ISC). This function should be assigned to carry out planning, procurement, exchange, crude oil sales, intermedia, and commercial and operational refinery products.
